metadata.synopsis: Ulma, the leader of Gur Tribe, talks to Astarion-avatar. Gur Hunter from Act 1, if he is alive, also present.Scene Trigger - WYR_GurCamp_Intro_SceneTrigger_8c9acc78-9d97-4d0f-919e-3997c015ed7f
metadata.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)For AOMAstarion - Recruit - As AvatarAstarion - Origin Moments - Gur CampApproach the Gur Camp as Astarion Avatar.For OOMAstarion - Recruit - As CompanionAstarion - Origin Moments - Gur CampApproach the Gur Camp as Astarion Companion without other characters in party.

33.speaker: Ulma
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking onto a pyre, where a variety of possessions are being burned - armour and broken weapons, as well as clothing, NodeContext: REK tay ee HATH-ran ROOST

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: Yes, I remember your hunter from the swamp. It didn't end well for him.
20.context: NodeContext: Referring to a hunter you killed.

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: I - if I can help them, I will. But you have to understand that Cazador is merciless. There's every chance they're already dead.

55.speaker: Astarion
55.text: Yes, I remember your friend. And how he was left trudging around a swamp.
55.context: NodeContext: responding to "I'd love nothing more than to throw you onto that fire"

57.speaker: Astarion
57.text: Here I am. Now what do you want?
57.context: NodeContext: responding to "I'd love nothing more than to throw you onto that fire"

90.speaker: Ulma
90.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking onto a pyre, where a variety of possessions are being burned - armour and broken weapons, as well as clothing, NodeContext: REK tay ee HATH-ran ROOST

49.speaker: Ulma
49.text: Frey vald isk durovna. Frey vald isk ablast.
49.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: *You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - the same monster hunters you met in the hag's swamp. Their leader is burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*
9.context: NodeContext: IM or-AK nay tay. KRAS-in nay TRAH

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - the same monster hunters you met in the hag's swamp. Their leader is burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*
26.context: NodeContext: IM or-AK nay tay. KRAS-in nay TRAH

32.speaker: Narrator
32.text: *You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - the same monster hunters you met in the hag's swamp. Their leader is burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*
32.context: NodeContext: IM or-AK nay tay. KRAS-in nay TRAH

7.speaker: Ulma
7.text: Im orak ne tay. Krasin ne trah!
7.context: NodeContext: IM or-AK nay tay. KRAS-in nay TRAH

14.text: So, the impossible spawn walks among us in the blazing sun. We have been looking for you.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ulma pauses for a moment, staring at the fire in contemplation before she turns and walks over to the player.

37.text: So, the impossible spawn walks among us in the blazing sun. We have been looking for you.

67.speaker: Ulma
67.text: So, the impossible spawn walks among us in the blazing sun. We have been looking for you.

30.speaker: Astarion
30.text: And here I am. What do you want?

5.speaker: Ulma
5.text: The last time you came to our camp, you stole our children. Our future.

29.speaker: Gandrel
29.text: When I was hunting you, I was to bring you back here. To interrogate you, discover how to save our children, and then destroy you.

81.speaker: Ulma
81.text: But things have changed. You have changed.

60.speaker: Ulma
60.text: Is it true you left your master? That you broke the spell that binds you to him?

0.speaker: Ulma
0.text: Then maybe you have a chance to redeem yourself.

86.speaker: Ulma
86.text: We have tried to save our children once already, attacking the vampire's palace at first light. Even then, it was too well defended.

64.speaker: Ulma
64.text: But you - you are someone he wants. Someone he thinks he can control, but with powers beyond his imagining.

58.speaker: Ulma
58.text: He will throw his doors open to you, lower his defences, and you will save the children you damned.

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: I'll do what I can for them, I promise.

27.speaker: Ulma
27.text: We know you as an evil man.

2.speaker: Ulma
2.text: Then we would choose revenge. We would see Cazador Szarr's legacy burned to nothing, and all vampires driven from Baldur's Gate.

4.speaker: Ulma
4.text: All but you. Do this for us and we will leave you alone.

73.speaker: Ulma
73.text: You have lived a life of violence and sin. You have stolen lives, broken families, and caused immeasurable grief.  Doing this will not right those wrongs.

71.speaker: Ulma
71.text: But it will be a start. You may still be redeemed.

53.speaker: Ulma
53.text: Please, go. Time is short, but we will see you again when it is done.

83.speaker: Astarion
83.text: And if I decline to help?

42.speaker: Ulma
42.text: Then we can all see what you really are. At best, a coward. At worst, a monster.

78.speaker: Astarion
78.text: You think you can guilt me into doing what you're too weak to?

21.speaker: Ulma
21.text: We offer you a chance, perhaps your final chance, to heal just some of the pain you have caused.

76.speaker: Ulma
76.text: So, tell us - who are you? Someone worthy of redemption or the monster the world believes you to be?

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: All right, I'll do what I can.

19.speaker: Astarion
19.text: Forget it, I'm not sacrificing myself for your cause.

47.speaker: Ulma
47.text: Then we have no use for you. And you must pay for your sins.

54.speaker: Ulma
54.text: A monster indeed. Hunters, to me!

1.speaker: Ulma
1.text: Then I shall make things simple. You stole our little ones from us - can you steal them back from your master?

69.speaker: Astarion
69.text: What does it matter to you?

45.speaker: Ulma
45.text: It matters because you are the last hope to rescue our little ones from Cazador Szarr.

79.speaker: Astarion
79.text: I have nothing to say to you or your people.

52.speaker: Ulma
52.text: When we sent Gandrel after you, we wanted to interrogate you. To discover how to save our children and then destroy you.

70.speaker: Astarion
70.text: I noticed. It didn't end well for the hunter I met in the swamp.

75.speaker: Ulma
75.text: You would be wise not to dredge up the past, spawn.

15.speaker: Astarion
15.text: I know. I remember your friend from the swamp.

6.speaker: Gandrel
6.text: Hello again, my erstwhile quarry. I did not think to see you here of all places.

62.speaker: Astarion
62.text: Really? You should have tried looking harder.

25.speaker: Gandrel
25.text: I looked for you high and low, across mountain and swamp. You were an elusive quarry indeed.

77.speaker: Astarion
77.text: If you want a fight, you're going to need a bigger funeral pyre.

34.speaker: Ulma
34.text: Choose your words carefully, spawn. I would happily see you burn for your sins.

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - a tribe of monster hunters you've had dealings with before. Their leader is burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*

72.text: *You've clearly walked into some kind of ceremony, but it's nothing that you recognise.*

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *You've clearly walked into some kind of ceremony, but it's nothing that you recognise.*

88.speaker: Narrator
88.text: *You do recognise the language, however. These people are Gur, a tribe of monster hunters just like the one you met in the hag's swamp.*

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *You do recognise the language, however. These people are Gur, a tribe of monster hunters you've had dealings with before.*
